alert.note: Alert for Windham (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 22 at 8:20PM EDT until May 22 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM EDT FOR NORTHERN WINDHAM...NORTHERN TOLLAND...NORTHEASTERN HARTFORD... SOUTHWESTERN WORCESTER...SOUTHEASTERN HAMPSHIRE AND SOUTHEASTERN HAMPDEN COUNTIES... At 819 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hardwick to Somers, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Amateur radio and radar indicated. At 810 PM, a large tree was downed in Warren from these severe thunderstorms. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Worcester, Springfield, Enfield, Shrewsbury, Ludlow, Grafton, Holden, Webster, Southbridge, Auburn, Longmeadow, Suffield, East Longmeadow, Belchertown, Wilbraham, Oxford, Millbury, Charlton, Palmer and Stafford. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
